stanza.line: Some glory in their birth some in their skillskill
Some in their wealth some in their body forceforce
Some in their garments though new-fangled illill
Some in their hawks and hounds some in their horsehorse
And every humour hath his adjunct pleasurepleasure
Wherein it finds a joy above the restrest
But these particulars are not my measuremeasure
All these I better in one general bestbest
Thy love is better than high birth to meme
Richer than wealth prouder than garments costscosts
Of more delight than hawks and horses bebe
And having thee of all men pride I boastboast
Wretched in this alone that thou mayst taketake
All this away and me most wretchcd makemake
